metadata.title: Interferon-β deficiency at asthma exacerbation promotes MLKL

body_text.text: Western-blot analysis 27 Equal protein amount of lung homogenate were diluted in 1:1 volume sample Laemmli buffer 28 (Sigma-Aldrich, Stockholm, Sweden) and boiled for 5 min. The extracts were loaded on a 15 µL 29 well Mini-protean TGX gel (Bio-Rad, Stockholm, Sweden) and separated by gel electrophoresis 30 using a mini protean tetra cell system electrophoresis chamber (Bio-Rad, Stockholm, Sweden) . 31
The proteins were then transferred to TransBlot Turbo mini nitrocellulose membrane (Bio-Rad, 32
Stockholm, Sweden) with Trans-blot Turbo transfer system (Bio-Rad, Stockholm, Sweden) and

BIBREF0.title: LDH levels in BALF were measured by cytotoxicity detection kit according to manufactures 62 protocol

BIBREF1.title: RNA isolation and gene expression quantification by RT-qPCR 65 RNA extraction kit Nucleospin® RNA II (Macherey-Nagel, Düren, Germany) was used to isolate 66 total RNA from right lung lobe homogenate and reverse transcribed to cDNA with Precision 67

BIBREF4.title: Analysis of samples was performed 70 by the ΔΔCt method and related to 18S expression as previously described (1)

BIBREF5.title: Analysis of relative gene expression data using 75 real-time quantitative PCR and the 2− ΔΔCT method

FIGREF0.text: 33 then blocked in 5% milk or 5 % BSA (Sigma-Aldrich, Stockholm, Sweden), TBS-T (20 mM Tris-34 base, 137 mM NaCl, 0,1 % Tween 20). Following primary antibodies were used and diluted 35 1/1000 in TBS-T with 5% BSA (Sigma-Aldrich, Stockholm, Sweden): pMLKL (abcam#196436), 36 cleaved caspase-3 (Cell Signaling, Beverly, USA, #9664), cleaved PARP (Cell Signaling, Beverly, 37 USA #9544), caspase-8 (Cell Signaling, Beverly, USA #8592), RIP3 (Cell Signaling, Beverly, USA 38 #15828), and GAPDH (Cell Signaling, Beverly, USA #5174). Membranes were incubated with 39 primary antibodies at 4 C°. Membranes where then washed in TBS-T with 5% milk or 5% BSA, 40 for 2x 15 minutes and then washed in TBS-T for additional 15 minutes. Anti-rabbit secondary 41 antibodies #31460 (Thermo Scientific, Waltham, USA) or anti-rabbit # 7074 (Cell Signaling, 42 Beverly, USA) conjugated to HRP were directed towards primary antibodies and incubated for 1 43 hour. pMLKL were stripped for RIP3 and caspase-8 with western blot stripping buffer (Thermo 44 Scientific, Waltham, USA). Proteins were visualized with West Femto SuperSignal detection kit 45 (Thermo Scientific, Waltham, USA) and optical density from the bands was detected by using LI-46 COR odyssey Fc imager system (LI-COR, Lincoln, USA). Ratio of optical band density between 47 samples and GAPDH were calculated in Microsoft Excel and normalized towards saline or wild-48 type HDM/dsRNA. The mean of the normalized optical density are presented. 49 50 TUNEL staining 51 In situ cell death detection kit fluorescein (Roche, Mannheim, Germany) was used for TUNEL 52 analysis. Sections were deparaffinized and gradually rehydrated. Antigen-retrieval was performed 53 by addition of 20 µL of 20 mg/ml proteinase K (Sigma-Aldrich, Stockholm, Sweden) during 20 54 minutes at 37 o C. TUNEL mixture was then added to all sections and incubated 1 hour at 37 o C. Study Design. 85 Mice were challenged with 25 µg HDM or saline intranasally 3 times/week for 3 86 weeks. For the exacerbation model, HDM or saline challenged mice received 50 µg 87 or 100 µg dsRNA or saline for 3 additional days. Differential cell count in BALF. 91 (A) Percentage macrophages in BALF. (B) Percentage neutrophils in BALF. (C). Percentage 92 lymphocytes in BALF. (D) Percentage eosinophils in BALF. The data are
